comment._content: This view probably hasn't changed much!

comment.author: 48247074@N00
comment._content: snidegrrl: actually, there are probably more trees now.

comment.author: 48889055628@N01
comment._content: If the land had cattle or horses on it, the fences were probably to keep the animals from trampling/spreading the hay. You see this on farms today, I believe, only with metal gates. The animals can still eat and the hay stays in a nice stack.
